page.title: 05 Social concerns in Polstead
page.content: Currently Polstead parish council is concerned with the state of the local roads,which are full of "potholes"after the winter's snow and ice;the parish council is pressing for repairs and improvements.None are main roads or direct links with other places,but many residents are commuters,and the ever increasing size of farm machinery and delivery lorries make the narrow lanes well used.The state of the village green is also high on the list for improvement,it is used freely for car-parking,and,in an attempt to preserve the appearance of the green,the parish council is in the process of purchasing some"Grasscrete" for a small area of the Green.This will be costly,but,should it prove successful,it is hoped to purchase more "Grasscrete" in order to tidy the green and facilitate parking.
